descriptions.overview: Winner of the popular mechanics editor's choice award and the retailers' choice award of distinction, the Speedlite® Square is an all-around crowd pleaser. This Square is an 8 in. lightweight version of the Swanson® speed® Square, first developed by company founder Albert Swanson in 1925. The innovative Speedlite® Square is everything you know and love about the speed® Square, but it’s especially great for use with siding and other delicate materials, since it won’t mar soft finishes. This innovative tool combines 5 tools into 1: 1. Try Square, 2. Miter Square, 3. Saw guide, 4. Line scriber, and 5. protractor. This model is constructed of lightweight, high-impact composite and is available in gray and high-visibility orange, and high-visibility yellow. The Speedlite® Square also includes markings for using the Swanson® one-number® method of rafter layout. The Swanson® Speed® Square is our most popular product and remains the most trusted Square of its kind. Look for the Diamond® cutout for genuine Swanson® products.
list: This lightweight version of the Speed® Square, made in the USA since 1925, is essential for every carpenter, construction professional, roofer, and DIYer
Multi-tool: Try Square, Miter Square, saw guide, line scriber, and protractor. for what it does, the Speed® Square belongs on every tradesman's tool bench
Features: 1/8 in. spaced scribing notches and the Diamond® cutout for easy rafter seat cuts and scribing the most common and popular stud widths
Made of lightweight, high-impact structural composite
Gradations included for marking common, hip, valley, and jack rafters. Useful for determining and marking angles and making Square cuts on boards
Available in matte gray, high-visibility yellow, and high-visibility orange
Use this Speed® Square to at-a-glance determine out-of-square corners, angles, etc
Beveled edge for ease of reading

reviews.title: "Great plastic speed square"
reviews.text: I bought one of these at Lowe's 6½ years ago. It was my first speed square, and I've used it in countless DIY projects ever since in lieu of a combo square. A year or so ago, I dropped it and broke off about ½ inch of one point. No big deal. This morning, I noticed a crack both ways across the diamond hole. It's given a lot of excellent service, and has lasted longer than I would have expected from plastic. I'm on the site right now checking out the aluminum version for my next purchase. It should outlast me! That said, the plastic one is a great value for more limited use.
reviews.author: MaverickDIY

reviews.title: "Right angle circular saw helper cutting right angl"
reviews.text: When cutting with a circular saw and want a straight cut, this triangle is a must. A great substitute for a table saw for the true 90° cut. Thanks to the great sales person to show me the right tool for the job. Thanks Lowes, you guys rock.
reviews.author: buggy

reviews.title: "SpeedSquare, 8 inch."
reviews.text: Works well. Useful and also within tolerances of measurements. Provides a good straight line across a diameter and also easily readable information on the face of the item.
reviews.author: JayJ

reviews.title: "works well"
reviews.text: light weight. easy to use just like my metal speed squares except I 'm not concerned about wet treated lumber corroding the aluminum.
reviews.author: Harrysdaddy

reviews.title: "Keep it straight!"
reviews.text: Was out of town and helping build a deck. Left my Square at home and needed one to assist in building new trusses. Dropped by Lowes and found this inexpensive square that did a great job for us!
reviews.author: Gatorbait

reviews.title: "Works as designed"
reviews.text: This speed square is a great tool and very useful in the wood shop. Unfortunately, being plastic, it is not very durable and will more often than not break when dropped or stressed. I have replaced this tool multiple times as it is light, accurate, easy to use and inexpensive. I also have a metal speed square but like the plastic ones for all the reasons mentioned. Just have to handle with care.
reviews.author: Woody

reviews.title: "Bright orange and awesome."
reviews.text: If you need to make a right angle line on a board that is less than 8 inches wide, this is the tool you need to have.  There is a bunch of other stuff on it too related to framing, or roofing, or something, but, if you are like most people, and just need a straight line that is perpendicular to the edge of your board, this works flawlessly.And it is bright orange.  You would think that would make it hard to disappear in your tool bag or just sitting there on the bench, but oh no, this little guy will disappear right in front of you just as fast as any color speed square you can find.
reviews.author: RH

reviews.title: "Looks to be highly accurate."
reviews.text: I needed a square for a small reno project and this filled the bill.
reviews.author: Vance

reviews.title: "8 inch Square"
reviews.text: Good quality square.
reviews.author: Riverside

reviews.title: "Simple and perfect"
reviews.text: I wanted to get a starter ruler for my wood working project and this was perfect. I measured angles, made lines and everything came out perfectly. This is a cheap and easy thing to get.
reviews.author: Woodchip

reviews.title: "Great"
reviews.text: Great speed square for small projects although I'd recommend getting the metal version as it doesn't chip or get knicks when it's dropped
reviews.author: Trisften

reviews.title: "Worth it!"
reviews.text: This tool is very simple and if misused, could easily be broken, but if used how intended, it will serve its purpose and then some!
reviews.author: djcaptmystery

reviews.title: "Excellent"
reviews.text: I needed a new one cause my other got stolen and it works just as good as my old one, and with it being orange it's easy to find.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.text: I used the square with ease. When I was done, I put it up on a nail. With the bright color, I can find it easier.
reviews.author: Vernon

reviews.title: "Speed square is great to work with."
reviews.text: I love that it is a stand out color and so easy to find if misplaced ! Price was well worth it too !
reviews.author: Jack

reviews.title: "fast and square"
reviews.text: Works just like the more expensive metal ones. A lot easier to find when I set it down.
reviews.author: Moosedrool

reviews.title: "Speedlite 8-in square"
reviews.text: Good little square for home shops. Only reason for a 4-star is because it isn't metal!
reviews.author: Ski

reviews.title: "speedy triangle works as a square"
reviews.text: works good for making sure cuts are 90 degree, light, easy to use...
reviews.author: GearHeadMark

reviews.title: "carpenter square"
reviews.text: good enough to get the job donesomewhat fragile so don't step on it
reviews.author: SASFixer

reviews.title: "Simply Terrific!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"
reviews.text: Oh!!!!!!!!!!!! what a treat for my straight line.Must have .
reviews.author: James

reviews.title: "*5 Cents? Can't Go Wrong"
reviews.text: I bought two they were so cheap. They seem to work great.
reviews.author: Odie

reviews.title: "great design"
reviews.text: I bought this to replace a worn square I have had for 21 years that has a few burs in the plastic. I like the notches inside this one to use for marking. If I can keep up with it should be my last square.
reviews.author: Wendell

reviews.title: "great little tool"
reviews.text: I've had one for 25+ years and finally broke. Needed new one.
reviews.author: Joey

reviews.title: "Handy Tool"
reviews.text: I love a speed square! Super handy. Does what it is supposed to do. Durable.
reviews.author: P8check

reviews.title: "Squared away"
reviews.text: I have been needing a speed square for a while and I am so glad I finally purchased this. I have used the square more in the past month and I have used most of the other tools that I have. Thankful to have been able to purchase this for such a fantastic price.
reviews.author: Joseph

reviews.title: "8inch square"
reviews.text: good price,love the bright color, now I can see it where I put it and nobody can take it, too bad the numbers aren't in white so you can see the inches, but it does the job and makes it much easy to get straight lines and correct measurement for angle cuts
reviews.author: joe

reviews.title: "Great speed square!"
reviews.text: Inexpensive but not cheap. Solidly built, lightweight, perfect for what I bought it for, cutting tile at angles to get around walls and other impediments. Would recommend to anyone who is in need of a speed square.
reviews.author: marinepilot

reviews.title: "Nice inexpensive speed square"
reviews.text: This little square is a replacement for one I had a long time. Only reason for replacing was that it got run over.Perfect for the weekend handy man around the house.
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "Works for the job it's intended"
reviews.text: We use these everyday for marking 90* or 45*. They can be used for roughly measuring other angles but it is not as accurate as a protractor.
reviews.author: Hunter

reviews.title: "Small Speed Square"
reviews.text: Great price, and this small Speed Square is super handy and easy to use. I build small projects and it's perfect for those jobs.
reviews.author: Jackson

reviews.title: "Great for the beginner"
reviews.text: I'm just getting into woodworking and this has come very handy so far. I haven't tried it as a guide yet, but plan to do so.
reviews.author: Toodlz

reviews.title: "A must have for any carpenter"
reviews.text: Sometimes you don't need a very large T-square and this is perfect for those places right areas
reviews.author: Kyshaws25

reviews.title: "It's...orange?"
reviews.text: Exactly what and how it should be. Easy to use and does the job. Color makes it easy to find.
reviews.author: MommaBear

reviews.title: "Cheap, Functional"
reviews.text: If you need a speed square, this one will do just fine.  Visible, functional, priced right.
reviews.author: Sir

reviews.title: "Small Speed Square"
reviews.text: This was so helpful.  First use was in building a new brood box for the bee hive
reviews.author: Shovel

reviews.title: "Great Value"
reviews.text: nice to have when you need a tool and don't have to pay a arm and a leg for it!
reviews.author: Wayne

reviews.title: "Just what I needed."
reviews.text: Very handy for small jobs around the house, and great for storage.
reviews.author: Dee

reviews.title: "Speed square"
reviews.text: So far it's worked great I would recommend this to any my friends
reviews.author: Bling

reviews.title: "Good solid piece"
reviews.text: It's made of hard plastic, but does exactly what you want it to.
reviews.author: waternchlorine

reviews.text: Good tool for my toolbox.  Especially like the color.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "GOOD SQUARE"
reviews.text: Good lightweight square. Does what it needs to do.
reviews.author: Shawn
